meanings.definition: To put something down in a flat or horizontal position.
meanings.sent1: Please lay the book on the table.
meanings.sent2: She likes to lay out her clothes for the next day.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to lay on the warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: The sun will lay its rays across the field at dawn.
meanings.sent5: He carefully lay the fragile vase on the shelf.

meanings.sent1: The hen will lay eggs in the coop.
meanings.sent2: Birds lay eggs in nests to keep them safe.
meanings.sent3: The Easter bunny doesn't lay chocolate eggs.
meanings.sent4: The golden goose will lay a magical egg.
meanings.sent5: The robin will lay blue eggs in the spring.

meanings.definition: A simple narrative poem or song.
meanings.sent1: She wrote a lay about the hero's journey.
meanings.sent2: The bard sang a lay of love and loss.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed listening to the lay by the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The lay of the troubadour captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The ancient lay told of a brave knight's quest.
